snippet: “Gateway to Freedom,” a book about the Underground Railroad by Eric Foner, began with the notebook of an abolitionist editor, Sydney Howard Gay.
abstract: Gateway to Freedom: The Hidden History of the Underground Railroad, latest book from Columbia University historian Eric Foner, traces antislavery efforts in New York City from the early 1700s to the years before the Civil War; effort began with the unexpected discovery of a notebook by abolitionist editor Sydney Howard Gay.
lead_paragraph: “Gateway to Freedom,” a book about the Underground Railroad by Eric Foner, began with the notebook of an abolitionist editor, Sydney Howard Gay.
